required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Enhancing Well-Being Through Exercise During Old Age
clinical_study.official_title: Enhancing Well-Being Through Exercise During Old Age

brief_summary.textblock: Determine the feasibility of adapting Fit & Strong!, an evidence-based group physical activity and health education program, to include affect and mood-related content and of employing this intervention among older adults with a range of depressive symptoms.

detailed_description.textblock: The specific aims of this pilot are to use a small RCT with a waitlist control design to: 1) Determine the feasibility of adapting Fit & Strong! to include affect and mood-related content and of employing this intervention among older adults with a range of depressive symptoms. 2) Begin to determine whether Fit & Strong! is efficacious as an approach for improving positive affect, reducing negative affect, decreasing symptoms of depression, and improving cognition among older adults. 3) Explore the relationship between negative/positive affect and symptoms of depression and maintenance of physical activity between baseline and 2 months, in order to determine whether improved positive affect and reduced negative affect and depression and improved cognition are associated with an increase in physical activity.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are randomized to the intervention or wait-list group.

primary_outcome.measure: Adherence to the Fit & Strong! intervention
primary_outcome.description: Attending two-thirds of the 24 sessions over 8 weeks
Positive evaluation of the intervention assessed during the debriefing session

secondary_outcome.description: Measures of positive and negative affect
Self reported increase in level of physical activity

arm_group.description: The 8-week intervention will consist of the Fit & Strong! program adapted to address the impact of exercise on enhancing positive affect and reducing negative affect and depressive symptoms. Exercise classes will meet three times per week for 90 minutes per session for eight weeks. Each class is divided into 60 minutes of strength training, flexibility, and cardiovascular exercise and 30 minutes of group education/discussion, which has been adapted to include affect-oriented content.
Participants randomized to the wait list group, receive the 8-week Fit & Strong! intervention after the intervention group has completed it.

intervention.description: The 8-week intervention will consist of the Fit & Strong! program adapted to address the impact of exercise on enhancing positive affect and reducing negative affect and depressive symptoms. Exercise classes will meet three times per week for 90 minutes per session for eight weeks. Each class is divided into 60 minutes of strength training, flexibility, and cardiovascular exercise and 30 minutes of group education/discussion, which has been adapted to include affect-oriented content

Participants randomized to the wait list group receive the 8-week Fit & Strong! intervention after the intervention group has competed it and after the wait list group has provided their post-outcomes.
